message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.CR, cs.EC. 

The paper discusses the use of Q-learning and Deep Reinforcement Learning to model the behavior of a self-interested, risk-averse tax entity in a government-controlled tax environment. This involves exploring a Markov Decision Process that includes random audits, penalties, and tax amnesties. The paper's focus on machine learning techniques and decision-making processes suggests that it is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper's exploration of game theory and optimization problems suggests that it may also belong to the Game Theory (cs.GT), Cryptography and Security (cs.CR), and Economics and Computation (cs.EC) sub-categories.
